title: Album Page, "Facade of Fonte Branda, Siena", October 14, 1899
medium: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, at upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 98; clockwise from bottom left: Other end Fonta Branda / Used as public lav... / Very ... and pretty; Fonte Branda / Used as Public Bath / Sienna [sic] / Oct 14th 1899; water fountain public bath ... / plan.
description: Vertical sheet depicting a large, triple-bay masonry edifice with a round arched entrance at center, flanked by two blind niches with round arched openings above.  The second level has three small square windows with small cornice and ruined space above with only columns standing.  Below left is a sketch of the interior of a public bath.  There is a large pool in the center of a rectangular space that is encircled by a colonnade.  At the far end of the room are two round arched openings.   At right is a plan view of a groin vaulted space, a rectangular colonnaded room with small arched bays around the perimeter, and another colonnaded rectangular room to the right.
